ygData.subject: Re: EQ video question
ygData.msgSnippet: What is the brand of your card? A gforce 3 or gforce 4ti will probably be your best improvement. Then more memory. At the present prices you could probably get
ygData.messageBody:
What is the brand of your card? A gforce 3 or gforce 4ti will
probably be your best improvement. Then more memory. At the present
prices you could probably get a gforce 3 plus up your memory to 512
for around $200. It would be a good move. I have even seen gforce 4ti
for around $175. Hopefully you have agp slots. I have only pci, so I
cannot do as I have recommended for you. sigh.

Barto Proudfoot

--- In EverQuest@y..., Rob LeBeau <rlebeau65@y...> wrote:
> I just bought a new machine and have a question. I
> had some Mouse issues but I solved those but now I get
> a little skip in the movement when I run or walk.
>
> It is like frame by frame. The machine is a 1.2 GHZ
> machine with 384 Ram and 32 MB video card.
>
> Now, my question is, "Does the video card with EQ make
> the difference or is it RAM?" The reason I ask is
> because when you choose the Luclin images it tells you
> how many to pick based on Ram and not Video memory.
>
> So does EQ use RAM more so than Video ram or not?
> I don't mind getting a 64 MB video card but I want it
> to work.
>
> My friend also sees the same issues but only has 256
> mb ram
>
> Thanks
>
